thread.title: Let It Shine results revealed: Iron Sun AXED from live final after "rubbish" sing-off
thread.title_full: Let It Shine results revealed: Iron Sun AXED from live final after "rubbish" sing-off

author: Nicola Agius
title: Let It Shine results revealed: Iron Sun AXED from live final after "rubbish" sing-off
text:
Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
The Let It Shine results are in - and, sadly, five more hopefuls are out. 
Together, Gary Barlow , Martin Kemp, Dannii Minogue and guest judge Ashley Roberts decided the bottom two bands were Drive and Iron Sun. 
After much deliberation, the expert panel gave the latter the boot, meaning they'll miss next week's eagerly-anticipated finale. 
Each of the two bands were forced to sing two Beatles classics - Something and The Long & Winding Road - which are largely considered hallowed pop music standards. Five To Five, Iron Sun, Drive and Nightfall battle it out (Photo: BBC) Ashley Roberts, Gary Barlow, Danni Minogue and Martin Kemp decided their fate (Photo: BBC) Read More 
So it's perhaps unsurprising that fans weren't impressed with the renditions. One cranky critic wrote on Twitter: "Autotune doesn't seem to be working someone must have turned it off by mistake". 
Then, another mused: "Watching kids massacre Beatles songs. Surprised how genuinely rubbish they all are." 
But that drama was quickly glossed-over when the results came through. Mark, Matt, Jonnie, Connor and Jazzie were granted passes to the crucial next round, which meant Alexis, Clinton, Matt, Harry and Jordan were sent home. 
Offering them cold comfort, Dannii Minogue said: "None of us know how it feels to be up there right now, but we do know how hard you've worked and nobody can take that away from you. Iron Sun were gracious in defeat - despite their obvious disappointment (Photo: BBC) Read More 'Somebody save them!' Let It Shine viewers concerned as piano is set on fire during Nightfall's performance 
"Keep going, keep working hard. You've been brilliant." 
Just a few moments earlier Five To Five (AJ Bentley, Curtis T Johns, Sario Solomon, Nick Carsberg, and Yazdan Qafouri) and competitors Nightfall (Bradley Johnson, Danny Colligan, Huw Robert, Jason Brock, and Julius Wright) had already made it through to the grand final. 
Five of them will ultimately form the cast of touring musical The Band. 
*Let It Shine returns to BBC One on Saturday at 6.55pm Like us on Facebook
